Description: Red pottery ostracon, from the shoulder-section of a globular vessel with narrow circular mouth, section of rolled rim also survives, with remains of ten lines of black-painted demotic text on the exterior and a further eight lines on the interior.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (92400) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/92400)
Acquisition name: Purchased through: R J Moss & Co
